title: For Sale:  Intratec tec-9
location: S/E Colorado Springs, Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
About 23 years ago, some U.S. Senators were on national TV telling us that the Intratec Tec-9 was the most dangerous gun ever made, and needed to be banned by make and model.

I decided that with that kind of review, I should buy one, and I did (new).
But I have mostly stored it, shot it very little. 

It comes with a barrel extension (useless except as a handle), 
a flash suppressor/muzzle brake (whichever it is)
the original canvas case, an instruction booklet, 
and 3 magazines that will hold 10 rounds each (9mm).

I hadn't fired it in years, so I took it out on 4 January 2013, and found that it still 
worked fine.

title: For Sale/Trade:  AR-15 magazines
postcontent:
USGI used 30rd ar-15 magazines 4 for $100.00 or $30.00 each.

call REDACTED or reply via email

In January, Senator Feinstein will introduce a bill to stop the sale, transfer, importation and manufacturing of military-style assault weapons and high-capacity ammunition feeding devises.

Summary of 2013 legislation


Following is a summary of the 2013 legislation:
•	Bans the sale, transfer, importation, or manufacturing of:
o	120 specifically-named firearms
o	Certain other semiautomatic rifles, handguns, shotguns that can accept a detachable magazine and have one military characteristic
o	Semiautomatic rifles and handguns with a fixed magazine that can accept more than 10 rounds

•	Strengthens the 1994 Assault Weapons Ban and various state bans by:
o	Moving from a 2-characteristic test to a 1-characteristic test
o	Eliminating the easy-to-remove bayonet mounts and flash suppressors from the characteristics test
o	Banning firearms with “thumbhole stocks” and “bullet buttons” to address attempts to “work around” prior bans

•	Bans large-capacity ammunition feeding devices capable of accepting more than 10 rounds.
•	Protects legitimate hunters and the rights of existing gun owners by:
o	Grandfathering weapons legally possessed on the date of enactment
o	Exempting over 900 specifically-named weapons used for hunting or sporting purposes and
o	Exempting antique, manually-operated, and permanently disabled weapons

•	Requires that grandfathered weapons be registered under the National Firearms Act, to include:
o	Background check of owner and any transferee;
o	Type and serial number of the firearm;
o	Positive identification, including photograph and fingerprint;
o	Certification from local law enforcement of identity and that possession would not violate State or local law; and
o	Dedicated funding for ATF to implement registration

title: For Sale/Trade:  AR 15 5.45 Upper Receiver, Magpul, 30 Rd Magazine, 1900+ Rounds
postcontent:
I have a Adams Arms, flat top, low profile gas block (no front site post), Magpul, piston driven 5.45 upper receiver with over 1,900 rounds(need to get exact count). Includes full upper, add any AR compete lower and it's ready to go! One 5.45 AR 30 round magazine is also included. Ammo is surplus and shoots great! Also have 36 BLACK TIP AP rounds made by Clark Custom and 7 HP rounds by Clark Custom Upper has had under 200 rounds through it. Also included heavy lower receiver spring never used. Haven't needed it but they provided it to me.

5.45 is the same round as the AK-74 and is nick named the poison bullet.  She thumps like a 5.56 AR when you shoot is.  Lots of fun to shoot!  If you have a spare lower or only have one, pop off your existing upper pin this in for good fun!

For those not familiar with Adams piston driven systems. Whole upper is coated so corrosive ammo does not hurt it. If you EVER have issues that guarantee it and will exchange or repair any issues for life. Gas pistons shoot MUCH cleaner than typical AR's especially with surplus ammo. It's a very high quality upper.

I live in IL and prefer to do FTF. But, This ammo is heavy! If you have a good and inexpensive way to ship everything, we can work it out. Buyer pays actual shipping cost.

FTF requires FOID due to ammo.  No wait (cool down) period required.  NO LOW BALL OFFERS.  I have a lot invested in this due to the quality of upper and ammo isn't as cheap as it use to be.

Please EMAIL me with offers, questions, or if you want additional pictures. Look forward to dealing with you guys!

title: For Sale:  (1) Case Danish 5.56 62gr M855 (light armor piercing ammunition)
postcontent:
One case of (750rds) 5.56 - M855 Steel Core light armor piercing ammunition -
5.56x45mm SS109/M855 ammunition is used by NATO forces throughout the world and considered to be among the best quality ammunition available. Manufactured to strict NATO military specifications for the DAMC (Danish Army Material Command) and carries the AMA headstamp with the NATO cross. The SS109 projectile features a 62 grain full metal jacket around a lead core with a steel penetrator tip. This standard NATO SS109 bullet is the same as the popular U.S. made M855, only no green paint is applied to the tip. The ammunition is first quality, new production ammunition, loaded in boxer primed, reloadable brass cases with Mil-Spec crimped sealed primers and sealed bullets. Each round is in the bright, pristine condition as the day it was loaded. There is no patina or tarnish - even the annealing coloration on the brass was removed before loading!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger bx-25 10/22 magazine
postcontent:
Ruger BX-25 10/22 magazine Brand new in package 

Call REDACTED

In January, Senator Feinstein will introduce a bill to stop the sale, transfer, importation and manufacturing of military-style assault weapons and high-capacity ammunition feeding devises.

Summary of 2013 legislation


Following is a summary of the 2013 legislation:
•	Bans the sale, transfer, importation, or manufacturing of:
o	120 specifically-named firearms
o	Certain other semiautomatic rifles, handguns, shotguns that can accept a detachable magazine and have one military characteristic
o	Semiautomatic rifles and handguns with a fixed magazine that can accept more than 10 rounds

•	Strengthens the 1994 Assault Weapons Ban and various state bans by:
o	Moving from a 2-characteristic test to a 1-characteristic test
o	Eliminating the easy-to-remove bayonet mounts and flash suppressors from the characteristics test
o	Banning firearms with “thumbhole stocks” and “bullet buttons” to address attempts to “work around” prior bans

•	Bans large-capacity ammunition feeding devices capable of accepting more than 10 rounds.
•	Protects legitimate hunters and the rights of existing gun owners by:
o	Grandfathering weapons legally possessed on the date of enactment
o	Exempting over 900 specifically-named weapons used for hunting or sporting purposes and
o	Exempting antique, manually-operated, and permanently disabled weapons

•	Requires that grandfathered weapons be registered under the National Firearms Act, to include:
o	Background check of owner and any transferee;
o	Type and serial number of the firearm;
o	Positive identification, including photograph and fingerprint;
o	Certification from local law enforcement of identity and that possession would not violate State or local law; and
o	Dedicated funding for ATF to implement registration

title: For Sale/Trade:  Troy Industries BattleMag 30 Round AR15 - BLACK - BRAND NEW MAGAZINE
postcontent:
For Sale: 3 individually packaged Troy Industries BattleMag's. They are black in color (not FDE or OD Green like everyone is trying to get rid of) and hold 30 rounds. Each is individually packaged (as pictured). Troy gives you more value than PMags by providing 2 different base plates: A pull tab base plate and a flush base plate. On top of that a Limited Lifetime Warranty. Asking $36 a piece or $99 for all 3. Thanks!

The Troy Industries Battlemag is an advanced polymer 30-round magazine for AR-15 style firearms in .223 Remington. The polymers used in the magazine are chemical, biological and impact resistant. The feed lips have been reinforced and the mag uses an anti-tilt follower. The mag body features a aggressive scale texture that provides a sure grip but will also extract from magazine pouches easily. The spine of the magazine is designed to prevent over-insertion common with some polymer mags. The floor plate features a shock absorbing pull tab, or can be used with the flush locking plate. Functions with all M4, M16, AR-15, HK416, and FN SCAR rifles.

title: For Sale:  Gemtech Tundra-SV 9mm Silencer
postcontent:
New in-stock on a From 3 and ready to transfer.  Gemtech Tundra-SV compact 9mm suppressor.

$699.00

Requires ATF $200 transfer tax.  We're happy to help you through the process if this is your first NFA purchase.

-Scott

K2 Firearms LLC
www.k2firearms.com

-9mm
-Aerograde 7075 Aluminum
-8.5oz
-6.5” long 
-½ x 28 TPI LID (Linear Inertial Decoupler) Included
-22LR and .300BLK (subsonic) compatible
-Fully Disassembleable
-Compatible with Gemtech MultiMounts

Born of a government request for a 9mm compact pistol suppressor that could be easily concealed and drawn from a daypack or case, the TUNDRA-SV was to provide the shortest size and greatest sound reduction without resorting to messy, telltale "wet" suppressor technology. At only 6.5" long including the LID pistol recoil device, the TUNDRA-SV is still quieter than some of our older pistol suppressors For the civilian consumer, we made this to utilize our MULTIMOUNT family of rear adapters, making this little silencer extremely flexible, easily adaptable to pistols, 9mm carbines, .300WSP/BLK subsonic, UZI, MP5, and more. TUNDRA-SV suppressors are completely take-apart, allowing for easy cleaning if subcaliber .22lr is desired. Aerograde 7075 baffles for light weight, and the body is finished in optically Flat Black Type III, Class II MIL-8625 spec-hard anodizing.

title: For Sale:  Ruger SR556E - AR15 Rifle
postcontent:
Ruger SR556E - AR15 Rifle
NYS Compliant (fixed stock, no flash suppressor, no bayonet lug)
10 Round Magazine
Rifle has a continuous upper rail and has the ability to add additional rails at 3, 6 and 9 o'clock.
As with all Ruger's, this rifle is built like a tank.

This is a piston driven rifle and as such does not run as dirty as the normal direct impingement system.  The gases are expelled externally (like an AK) rather than back into your reciever where they "gunk" up the bolt carrier.  The piston system also allows you to open up the gas port and allow more gas in if you have weak ammo.  This rifle was done right by Ruger.  Check out the reviews online.

Rifle had 10 rounds fired through it to function test it after purchase.  It functioned flawlessly and has been a "safe queen" ever since.  Rifle was bought in August 2012 and is in like new condition.

I am using the proceeds towards the purchase of a tractor and as such I am not able to take trades toward the rifle (sorry, but cash only).

Price:  $1,600 firm

title: For Sale/Trade:  AN/PVS4 Night Vision
postcontent:
taking offers the best way to get me is text REDACTED mine also has extras on it look at the link before making a offer















Sierra Pacific Innovations offers the AN/PVS-4 U.S. Military issue crewserved night vision weapon sight at discounted pricing.



The AN/PVS-4 Model Series night vision weapon sight is the same military system used extensively by U.S., NATO, and other military forces throughout the world.



Equipped with a super rugged chassis, precision military catadioptic lenses, and a U.S. 25mm image tube the pvs 4 offers incredible performance in ultra low light conditions.



It is suitable for use on a variety of weapons including 5.56 mm (.223) and 7.62 mm (.308) rifles. The PVS-4 houses an adjustable internally lit reticle and a 25mm 2nd or new 3rd Generation image intensifier tube which features ABC (Automatic Brightness Control) and Bright Source Protection (BSP).



The AN/PVS-4 allows the user to determine tube and reticle brightness with manual adjustments.



An optional Photo Adapter Ring can be used to connect the AN/PVS-4 to a 35mm SLR’s 50mm objective lens. You can use the AN/PVS-4 with an optional C-mount video relay lens on any C-mount videocamera.



Our AN/PVS-4 Series night sights include a .308 cal., .223 cal., or crosshair/dot reticle (choose one), AR-15/M-16 mounting block and securing knob, objective lens cap with integrated daylight training filter, shuttered combat eyeguard, cleaning kit, operating manual, two (2) AA batteries, water-resistant field carrying case, and a high-impact storage case.


IDEALFOR 

Precision night time and low light weapon sighting 
Street Gang Observation 
S.W.A.T Close-Range Shotgun Maneuvers 
Counterterrorism 
Drug Enforcement Covert work 
Patrol and Security 
Search and Rescue Operations 
Paratrooping 
Night Pursuit 
Firefighting 
Boating Piloting and navigation 
Paramedic Needs 
Infrared Light-Source Detection 


Primary function: Night vision device for passive night vision and aiming fire of individual weapons using ambient light (moonlight or starlight) for illumination. The AN/PVS-4 Model Series night vision weapon sight is the same military system used extensively by U.S., NATO, and other military forces throughout the world.

title: For Sale/Trade:  This will probably offend you but please read anyway
postcontent:
What the hell is wrong with people today? I ask because over the past several weeks I have kept my mouth shut in regards to the absolutely mind blowing amount of garbage or overpriced crap that people post on here. WTF?

First things first, please learn how to type. This does not go for everyone so if you can utilize proper grammar then disregard. For those of you that cannot, do a quick spell check and go from there. It's freaking simple to do and takes two seconds.

Next lets go over what deserves to be described with the word "custom". If you put a few things that you picked up at your local gun store on your rifle or pistol and it did not require a professional in any way, or you are not a professional gunsmith yourself, then you do not have an item that should be called custom. A fucking glock with an high cap magazine or a piece of shit NC Star laser does not qualify your gun as something that is, or probably ever will be, custom. Just because it's custom to you does not mean it's custom to the rest of the gun community. "One of a kind", "decked out", "tricked out" and countless other descriptive terms should be stricken as well. Unless you know for a fact that your gun is in fact one of a kind, don't say that shit. Do some research before you go all out over-exaggerating what you've got.  God only knows how many "one of a kind" straight from the factory rifles there are out there but I'm willing to bet that there are way more than your taking credit for.

Sniper scopes. Jesus Christ, there is no such thing as a sniper scope. Only when a scope is mounted to a weapon that is in the hands of an actual trained sniper could your scope be considered a sniper scope. We get it, your really great at sniping digital terrorists in call of duty or you hit a target that was really far away that one time, but if your not a sniper then you don't have a sniper scope. Just say what you've got and let that be that. Not need to try to make what you have sound cooler than what it is. Most of the people reading your ad have a google search page opened up to see what it is anyway so chances are they will figure it out. If your not a sniper do not use sniper as a description for your gun or optics.

To go along with "sniper rifles" and "sniper scopes", the word "tactical" is getting a little fucking ridiculous. Just because you saw it in a movie being used by a military bad ass, your weapon is just a weapon. How it is employed makes it tactical. The other day I read an ad for a "tactical" airsoft gun and wanted to punch through my living room windows for that genius display of dumb ass adjective word association. If your not using your gun to clear rooms, breach doorways or any other activity that would need a tactical approach, then drop the word tactical from the description. 

Over pricing. Seriously, I understand wanting to make money, but come the fuck on. I saw a guy post a Sig rifle that retails brand new almost 1000 less than what he initially posted it for. This website is intended to help people network to find guns they want, not to pad your wallet. Just because there's some idiot out there that will pay too much for something doesn't mean they should. It's borderline unethical to take advantage of the people out there that either don't know any better or don't care about spending more money than they should. 

While the world is riddled with all sorts of problems, this site usually offers far more solutions than problems. If I offended you, well, I don't apologize because you probably fit into one of the previously mentioned categories and you need to learn how to post an ad on this site. That or you need to stop over compensating for what you have. To anyone that I've enlightened or anyone that expresses the same feelings as I do then I hope this benefits each and everyone of you. Even the people that want to talk up their "one of a kind, tricked out, tactical custom AR15 sniper rifle" because every sniper in the world knows that something that shoots .223 is a real game changer in the sniper community. 

I'm probably going to get flagged or receive some hate mail but I don't really give a shit. If this little rant prevents even one over embellished ad from being posted ad from going up then it was worth the five minutes it took to write this.

postcontent:
Prefer Stainless with/ synthetic stock, but if the price is right other configurations will be considered.

Please understand that I understand that things are crazy right now, and there are folks out there trying to sell used guns for way more than they are actually worth.

I am not in a rush, and I can pass a background check (even if the current delays are annoying)... 

I am simply not going to pay more for a used gun than I can buy exactly the same model (or a more valuable one) new, but I can and will certainly pay CASH, IMMEDIATELY, for a fair offer. 

~~~These are not rare, nor are they in short supply.~~~

I also realize that there is a ton of aftermarket "stuff" available for these... If you spent hundreds of dollars on yours, cool... I don't want a $200 rifle you wasted $600 or more dollars on, to get it placed on the likely to soon be banned list... that was your choice, not mine...

Not my first rodeo, so please, let's not waste each other's time. I know there are a whole lot of flakes out there right now. I am not one of them.

Please Include your telephone number, and best time to call in your email.

I have seen a few advertised here, but no one seems to be responding...

Thought I'd try this method.
